alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 8:13AM CDT until May 16 at 4:31PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Wharton and Matagorda Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tres Palacios River near Midfield. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water spills into the flood plain on the right upstream bank and covers the meander point at the meander curve. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM CDT Tuesday was 27.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.3 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.2 feet on 09/16/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Tres Palacios River Midfield 24.0 24.1 Tue 7 am CDT 16.3 9.3 6.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM CDT.
